p: Boxer dogs breeding in Italy is regulated by Boxer Clubs. The Boxer Club of Italy (BCI) drafted the guidelines for the “selection” of dogs with morphological and attitudinal standards. Given the high prevalence of congenital heart diseases in Boxer dogs the BCI established a cardiovascular screening mandatory for the admission to the selection process. Screening data have been collected by either board‐certified cardiologist or operators, selected through a practical exam after a training. During this exam different operators examined the same Boxer and their findings were compared with those of the board‐certified (inter‐observer variability) and were compared also three measurements of the same dogs performed by each operator (intra‐observer variability). Current reference intervals for aortic annulus dimensions do not account for body weight (BW).
